extendedIngredients.name: chicken wings
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 to 10 cooked boneless buffalo chicken wings, halved

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: freshly chopped cilantro and green onions for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: ranch dressing
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup Hidden Valley Buffalo Ranch Dressing

recipes.title: Buffalo Ranch Chicken Pizza

winePairing.pairingText: Pizza works really well with Sangiovese, Barbera Wine, and Shiraz. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. The Story Winery, Sangiovese, Estate, Shenandoah Valley with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Story Winery, Sangiovese, Estate, Shenandoah Valley
productMatches.description: Aromas of raspberry, cherry, pie crust, tobacco and oak greet the nose. Dark cherries and raspberry predominate the palate with mild tannins and nice acidity. The finish is gentle and lasting Enjoy!

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.Lightly grease a 12" round pizza pan and press pizza dough into an even layer. Spread the Hidden Valley Buffalo Ranch Dressing over the base of the pizza dough, leaving 3/4 of an inch for the crust. Sprinkle the pizza with cheese, the cooked boneless buffalo chicken wing halves and the sliced purple onion. Bake for 13 to 16 minutes, or until golden brown and the crust is baked through. Sprinkle the top with freshly chopped cilantro and green onions before slicing and enjoying hot!

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.Lightly grease a 12" round pizza pan and press pizza dough into an even layer.

Spread the Hidden Valley Buffalo Ranch Dressing over the base of the pizza dough, leaving 3/4 of an inch for the crust. Sprinkle the pizza with cheese, the cooked boneless buffalo chicken wing halves and the sliced purple onion.
Bake for 13 to 16 minutes, or until golden brown and the crust is baked through. Sprinkle the top with freshly chopped cilantro and green onions before slicing and enjoying hot!
